org.ggp.base.util.ui

Class GameStateRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.util.ui.GameStateRenderer

  • public class GameStateRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    GameStateRenderer generates an image that represents the current state of a match, based on the current state of the match (in XML) and an XSLT that converts that XML match state into HTML. After rendering the match state in HTML as a DOM, it renders that DOM into a BufferedImage which can be displayed to the user. TODO: This class is still pretty rough, and I suspect there's much room for improvement. Furthermore, improving this class will yield immediate visible benefits, in terms of better visualizations and such. For example, when rendering games that don't take up the full 600x600 image, there's an empty black space on the final image, which looks bad. That could be fixed.
